subject: RE: [junit] XML Unit's funny problem: Help needed
msgSnippet: This is the classic ClassLoader issue... search the archives (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/messagesearch?query=linkage%20error) for LinkageError or
messageBody:
This is the classic ClassLoader issue... search the archives (http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/messagesearch?query=linkage%20error) for LinkageError or ClassLoader and you will find the fix.

BTW: There is a lot out in the archives that will answer some of these 'common' problems. It is an invaluable tool.

=jason

On Fri, 19 Apr 2002 12:59:18 +0530, "pragnesh.p" <pragnesh.p@...> said:
> This message only has an HTML part -- this is a text generated representation
>
>
> Thanx Mark It compiled
> However now i am facing a new problem. If i run the same class with
> the changes it gives me errors
> java.lang.LinkageError: loader constraints violated when linking
> org/w3c/dom/Document class at
> org.custommonkey.xmlunit.XMLUnit.buildDocument(Unknown Source)
> at org.custommonkey.xmlunit.Diff.<init>(Unknown Source) at
> org.custommonkey.xmlunit.Diff. <init>(Unknown Source) at
> org.custommonkey.xmlunit.XMLTestCase.compareXML(Unknown Source)
> at test_XMLTestCase.testCompareXMLStrings(test_XMLTestCase.java:45)
> And when i run the same class using junit.textui.TestRunner it runs
> smoothly.
> This is amusing. Can u give me some clue as to what is happening.
> Regards
> Pragnesh
> -----Original Message-----
> From: Mike Clark [mailto:mike@...]
> Sent: Thursday, April 18, 2002 7:50 PM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] XML Unit's funny problem: Help needed
> "pragnesh.p" wrote:
> > Hi,
> >
> > I have been asked to do some exploration on JUnit. I have
> finished exploration of JUnit and JUnitPerf and am currently exploring
> XmlUnit.
> > There is a funny problem which i am facing currently. When I
> compile test_XMLTestCase.java (a sample file given) with
> >
> > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > (new junit.textui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
> > }
> >
> > it compiles and runs without any problems.
> > However when i do the following change
> >
> > public static void main(String[] args) {
> > (new junit.swingui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
> > }
> >
> > It gives following error:
> >
> > test_XMLTestCase.java:297: cannot resolve symbol
> > symbol : method run (junit.framework.TestSuite)
> > location: class junit.swingui.TestRunner
> > (new junit.swingui.TestRunner()).run(suite());
> > ^
> > 1 error
> >
> > Does any one have an idea of watz happening.
> >
> The Swing UI's TestRunner uses run(Class test), rather than run(Test
> test).
> Try:
> new junit.swingui.TestRunner().run(test_XMLTestCase.class);
> Mike
> --
